description.item: A twelve-month calendar for 1899 attached to a color graphic of a female and a male cyclist. The calendar consists of twelve tear-off sheets attached by a staple to the lower left hand corner of the graphic. An easel support is attached to the back of the graphic so that it can serve as a standing calendar. The head and torso of the female cyclist is missing, as is the head and left forearm of the male cyclist. The calendar is an advertisement for McIntire, Magee and Brown, wholesale manufacturing and jobbing opticians, of Philadelphia.

collection.description: This collection contains lavishly illustrated early U.S. bicycle and bicycle parts manufacturers’ catalogs covering the period from 1890 through 1932, with the great majority published between 1890 and 1902. table_of_contents.item: [Typewritten promotional letter on Mead Cycle Company letterhead] -- [Mailing envelope, addressed to J. Coolidge, Plymouth Union, Vt.] -- Order blank [with accompanying return addressed envelope] -- The best business bicycle. Popular with particular people. The reliable roadster. The best value of the year [four-page catalog of bicycles] -- The pink of perfection : 1902 model Sentinel Special. 1902 Sentinel Road Racer : the cyclist's ideal [single-sheet catalog of bicycles] -- A few facts about saddles. Record "A" single-tube tires [single-sheet catalog of bicycle supplies] -- Twice the pleasure with half the work can be secured by using a New Departure coaster brake. -- Our stupendous offer on Sentinel bicycles [single-sheet catalog of bicycle supplies] -- Bargains in accessories and sundries [four-page catalog of bicycle supplies].

item.title: Collection of ephemera promoting Mead bicycles, sent to Joel M. Coolidge at Plymouth Union, Vermont in 1902.

item.note: Back of envelope addressed to Joel M. Coolidge stamped: Plymouth Union VT, May 5, 1902.
All items enclosed in a single pocket binder.
